com.github.fge.largetext

Class LargeText

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.largetext.LargeText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, CharSequence
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NotThreadSafeLargeText, ThreadSafeLargeText

    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public abstract class LargeText
extends Object
implements CharSequence, Closeable
    A large text file as a CharSequence: base abstract class

    There are two possible versions: a non thread safe version and a thread safe version. Expect a performance drop of 40% in the worst case scenario if you use a thread safe version.

    The reason for the two different implementations is that this class implements the principle of locality: when a caller calls CharSequence.charAt(int), chances are high that the next call to this method will hit the same TextRange. As such, the class keeps the last loaded text range and its matching buffer "at hand". The difference between the two implementations is how these two elements are retained:

    • in the non thread safe version, those are simple, non-volatile, instance variables;
    • in the thread safe version, those are in a ThreadLocal inner class instance.

    All other methods of CharSequence are implemented directly by this class and are not overridable.

    Important note! This class implements Closeable (and therefore AutoCloseable); the recommended use is therefore to use it in a try-with-resources statement:

         try (
         final LargeText largeText = factory.load(somePath);
         // or factory.loadThreadSafe(somePath)
     ) {
         // use "largeText" here
     }

    Failing to close the instance correctly means you leak a file descriptor to the text file you are using!

    BIG FAT WARNING: getting the contents of a CharSequence as a String using Object.toString() basically dumps the contents of the whole file!

    See Also:
    LargeTextFactory, NotThreadSafeLargeText, ThreadSafeLargeText
